user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of can_compress:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
can_compress (struct MHD_Connection *con)
{
  const char *ae;
  const char *de;

  ae = MHD_lookup_connection_value (con,
                                    MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                    MHD_HTTP_HEADER_ACCEPT_ENCODING);
  if (NULL == ae)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (0 == strcmp (ae,
                   "*"))
    return MHD_YES;
  de = strstr (ae,
               "deflate");
  if (NULL == de)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (((de == ae) ||
       (de[-1] == ',') ||
       (de[-1] == ' ')) &&
      ((de[strlen ("deflate")] == '\0') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ',') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ';')))
    return MHD_YES;
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function can_compress:
_MHD_EXTERN const char *
MHD_lookup_connection_value (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                             enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                             const char *key)
{
  const char *value;

  value = NULL;
  (void) MHD_lookup_connection_value_n (connection,
                                        kind,
                                        key,
                                        (NULL == key) ? 0 : strlen (key),
                                        &value,
                                        NULL);
  return value;
}
...
struct MHD_Connection
...
#define MHD_HTTP_HEADER_ACCEPT_ENCODING "Accept-Encoding"
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (((de == ae) ||
       (de[-1] == ',') ||
       (de[-1] == ' ')) &&
      ((de[strlen ("deflate")] == '\0') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ',') ||
       (de[strlen ("deflate")] == ';')))
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. de is obtained from strstr(ae, "deflate") and is checked for NULL before use, so when non-NULL there are at least the seven characters "deflate" at de; strlen("deflate") is applied to a string literal (safe) and de[strlen("deflate")] accesses the character immediately after the matched substring (either the terminating '\0' or a separator), which is within bounds. The de[-1] accesses are guarded by the (de == ae) left-hand test (short‑circuited), so no out‑of‑bounds access occurs.
